inn1.comm: full and straight to start off proceedings, it is solidly defended down the track.
back of a length, spongy bounce and a touch of inward cut. Hyatt stays in the crease and blocks to the off side.
wider of off stump, and straightens after angling in. Hyatt shoulders arms.
similar ball, this one dies from a length and Rahim takes it on the second bounce. Another leave.
another leave outside off as Shafiul goes fuller.
another full ball, Hyatt punches confidently to mid-on to end the over, a maiden.
full ball on off stump, off-driven to mid-off.

back of a length outside off, Powell defends to the off side from the back foot. A touch of Chris Gayle to this man's mannerisms at the crease. Tall, languid, minimalist.. Wonder if he is also menacing.
no menace so far, lets a length ball outside off go through to Rahim.
stays low outside off as Nazmul works away on a length. Powell defends into the off side.
half an appeal for lbw, the ball landed outside leg though and hit Powell high as he missed the whip.
better line, shaping away from leg to off again, but no seam movement. Powell works it through square leg for the first run.
whippy and angled across Powell, who throws his bat at it without moving. He misses and it is called wide.
well played. On the pads, and Powell places the whip well between mid-on and midwicket to get a couple. The ball barely travels across this outfield.
lets a ball very close to off stump go through to the keeper.
stays in the crease and laces a fuller ball gingerly, straight to point.
another leave. This is a sluggish start at many levels.
Powell times the straight drive well, but the ball slows down to allow mid-off to dive and stop.
Hyatt middles a leave - he was hauling the bat away, but a touch late and the ball went off the meat between point and the slips.
Nazmul keeps it full on middle and leg, Powell punches it back down the track.
Powell inside-edges a forcing drive off the pads onto the pads and the ball goes nowhere.
Powell gets a single this time, forcing the on-drive off the inner half to mid-on for a quickie.
full pitched ball on off stump to Hyatt, who plays it crisply back down the track. In no hurry to get off the mark.
opens the face this time as he presses forward, and steers defensively to point.
beaten outside off. Not necessarily because the ball moved off the straight, but because Hyatt chose to play well inside the line.
Powell shuffles across and opens the face, looking to steer from very close to off stump. If the ball bent in a touch he would have been in trouble, but this time he gets a single into the covers.
Hyatt moves nicely into a check-drive into the covers, but doesn't place it.
beaten outside off fore the second time in three balls, is Hyatt. This time Shafiul gets the ball to straighten after angling in from wide of the crease, and Hyatt pokes away from the body.
pretty poor technique from Hyatt. He gets half across, opens the face and dangles the bat in hope well outside off. If he middles it, it is likely to get a single at best. He misses, though.
Hyatt is finally away. Shafiul gets this to come in, Hyatt brings the bat down at the very last moment to get a single towards mid-on.
Shafiul swerves this one away from Powell, who is caught feeling for it well away from the body. Another miss.

over-pitched outside off - on this pitch, that's a smart ball to bowl. The firm cover drive goes no where, it just succumbs to inertia on the soggy outfield, and they labour through for a couple. The fielder who put in the slide to stop the ball manages to scuff out some damp grass out, and the groundsmen promptly trot out with a bucket of sawdust.
back of a length outside off, Hyatt shoulders arms.

and that's the end of Hyatt. A touch of frustration in the shot. Length ball, there for the drive outside off, but Hyatt seemed keen to smash it in the air instead of drive along the ground. He just plonked the front foot forward and heaved a touch early into the off side, but the ball took the outside edge to loop into the lone slip's hand.
Samuels likes playing on the back foot, and that's not a good idea on this pitch. His first ball stays low and he just about manages to keep it out as it darts in.
this one angles in, Samuels is again on the crease and defends to the on side.
well bowled Nazmul, gets the ball to nip away from Samuels who fishes from the crease.
Powell again moves into position and punches into the covers with assurance.

stop the press, a ball has reached the boundary. Pitched up by Shafiul, Powell had width to work with and used the bottom hand to impart a nice thump. The ball sped through the covers and reaches the ropes.
even fuller, but straighter this time, and Powell plays it into the off side.

slower ball on middle and leg stump, Powell spots it and defends down the track. The bowler picks up and hurls the stumps down, even as Powell moves back into the crease, and to his right to stay away from the throw thanks to the new rule.
works a full ball on leg stump to midwicket.
another good stroke from Powell, gets nicely behind a length ball and drives smooth and fluent through wide mid-off.
Samuels is away, dabbing a ball outside off stump backward of point for a single.
Powell check-drives to mid-off, was really a soft push, and there was enough time to scamper across for a single.
Samuels' technique nearly does for him. Stays back to a length ball that gripped the surface and sat up, and ended up scooping it just to the left of the bowler. Very close to a return catch, that.
again, moping on the back foot to a slow, length ball outside off. He manages to run this one off the face behind point for one.
pitched up to Powell who mistimes the on-drive.

half-volley on middle, and Powell plays the best shot of the day for no runs. He drives it right past the bowler and takes out leg stump at the non-striker's end. That ball was travelling, and would have reached the boundary if not for the timber obstacle.
wide of off stump and straightening, Samuels leaves.
another leave outside off, this time Samuels even gets forward.
full and wide of off stump, Samuels eases it towards deep backward point for one.
gem of a delivery from Shafiul, gets it to come in, hit the seam and then seam away prodigiously. Powell had no chance of even edging that, too good for him.
ends the over with a quiet push to the off side.
over-pitched outside off, Samuels can't time the drive despite being in such good form. Inner-edged onto the pads and rolls away to the off side.
full again, angled into the pads, and Samuels nudges it square for a single.
full ball on off stump, pushes into the covers off the front foot.
poor ball, full and outside leg side, Powell happily smears the flick behind square for a boundary.
over-pitched on off stump, firmly driven but straight to short cover.

lovely stroke from Powell. Too full again, and well outside off, but on this outfield that doesn't always translate to a boundary. Powell invoked his inner Saeed Anwar and Arjuna Ranatunga to thump the cover drive with a strong working of the bottom hand.
Samuels stays on the crease and pokes into the off side once again.
Powell edges a steer, and it goes on the bounce to the left of the widish slip fieldsman.
on the pads, Powell chips it off the pads to the on side.
Samuels might rather be facing Garner at Perth. He's not liking this at all. Another play and a miss from the crease as Shafiul keeps it on a leash.

if you didn't see that coming, you're following the wrong sport. Samuels is on his way. Length ball outside off, Samuels again refuses to reach forward and just looks to carve it over the off side from the crease. No pace to work with, at all. He ends up spooning it to sweeper cover where Shuvo takes an easy catch.
Powell guides a length ball into the covers for a single.
speared into the pads, Powell stays back and looks to force to the leg side. Hit on the pads.

what a stunner. Powell's gone to a piece of Muralitharanesque mystery from Hossain. Tossed up, curving in, pitched on leg stump, gripped, spun and beat the outside edge to hit off stump and leave the batsman completely befuddled. All similarities with Murali ended there, as Hossain celebrates with an ugly WWE gesture - the DX chop to be spedcific. The crowd seems to like it, though.

Two balls back Nasir had no ODI wickets. Now he is on a hat-trick. Tossed up outside off and turning in, draws Pollard forward and he helpfully pats it back to the bowler at a perfect catching height. Windies in big trouble now.
no hat-trick. It was a full ball on middle and off, Sammy carefully plays to the leg side.
full again, Sammy drives down the ground for a single.
Bravo gets forward to a flighted ball and covers the line to defend to the off side.
this ball dies outside off from a length. Sammy played over it and looked quite bemused as it went past.
inner edge, goes between stumps and pads towards backward square leg for one.
length ball outside off, Bravo doesn't play at it.

If there's rain coming, West Indies are doing their bit to ensure it doesn't wash out the game. Bravo perishes now, to a lazy square drive away from the body as Shafiul plugs away on a length just outside off. The ball did nothing off the pitch, it didn't bounce much either and was dying alarmingly on Rahim who takes a very smart catch, low down.
angled into Ramdin's pads, he is away with a neat flick towards midwicket.
Ramdin defends a ball from outside off to the man at mid-off.

whoa, another wicket. Sammy gives his critics more grist to work with. It was Shakib's usual fare, angled in from slightly wide of the crease and straightening from middle. Sammy played an appalling shot, plonking the front foot forward and looking to play well away from the pad with an angled face when he should have brandished straight bat. He misses, Shakib hits him flush in front, and umpire Reiffel does the rest.
full on middle and off, played to the leg side watchfully.
tossed up and straightening from leg stump, Brathwaite defends with a straight bat.
too straight and it runs down towards fine leg for a leg-bye
Denesh plays the flick early and it takes the leading edge to pop into the covers for one.
Brathwaite moves across to middle and off and defends down the track with bat and pad close together.
flighted ouytside off, played tentatively towards point.
worked with the turn towards midwicket.
tossed generously up, tapped down the ground for a single.
turning in from outside off, Carlos turns it square but can't get the single.
worked with the spin to square leg once again.
shorter this time, played against the spin into the off side.
flighted ball on leg stump, leading edge taken as Carlos looks to work it to the leg side and he turns around in confusion to see it go down towards short third man.

easy as they come. Shakib skids one along, straight in after landing short of a length on off stump. Ramdin's bat-pad gap was so huge as he played for the spin, you could have built a Dubai-standard mall in that space. The ball had the easy job of finding its way through and hitting the stumps.
this one hurries in too, Russell was well forward in defending and it was going down the leg side.
going down the leg side, Russell looks to sweep and gets a top edge down to fine leg for two.
Russell tentatively reaches forward to defend a full ball.
looks to monster a half-volley down the ground and gets the inside edge onto his boot.
squares him up with his first ball as it grips and breaks away in madcap fashion.
Brathwaite covers the line this time and defends.
worked cautiously from the crease to the leg side.

West Indies are in a daze, they are batting in Zombie-fashion here. Another return catch. Shuvo flights this on middle and leg, a little quicker than the previous ball, and Russell pops it right back at him after reaching out. They haven't made any adjustments for the slow pitch. Unacceptable.
over-pitched on middle and off, Roach dead-bats it.
another full ball to end the over, Roach again smothers it off the front foot.
defended into the off side off the front foot.
Carlos whips a full ball from Shakib through square leg, and WI have 50 at long last.
Carlos drives with the turn into the off side for one.
another big appeal for lbw as Shakib straightens one from middle and leg. This wasn't doing enough, though, and Reiffel says no.
edged, but doesn't carry to slip. Roach lunges and prods at one that breaks away.
Carlos continues to defend resolutely from the crease.
fuller ball, pushed past the bowler for a single
grip and spin again, Roach keeps it down to the off side, even as two slips and silly point watch with interest.
looks to force off the middle and leg line this time, but can't beat mid-on.
over-pitched and driven firmly but straight to cover.
holds it back a touch, and Roach defends into the covers.
worked off the pads to the leg side.
fuller on off stump, defended back to the bowler.
full toss, and Carlos happily latches on with a well-timed whip past midwicket. West Indies inch towards 58.

58 is still some way away and the Windies are nine down. They just can't play spin in these conditions. Shakib again sends in that straighter one that just skids along after landing on off stump. Brathwaite offered bat and pad in hope, but the ball missed the willow and headed for the foam. Plumb as they come, despite the big forward stride.
full on middle and off, the No. 11 does well to dead-bat it.
full-pitched on middle and off, dourly defended into the off side.
similar ball, Roach again stabs it out cautiously.
and this one breaks away, Roach is caught groping inside the line and it shaves the edge to go through to the keeper.
fuller from Shuvo and Roach covers the line to defend.
defends again, with the spin into the off side.
gets good connection on the cover drive this time, but he finds the fielder.

over-pitched on off stump, it is dragged to mid-off for a risky single. The throw from Hossain wasn't great, Mushfiqur had to collect from a yard away and whips the bails off. A direct hit would have meant 57 all out.
flighted on the stumps, Roach blocks again.
turned away off the pads to the man at midwicket.
lunges out and defends with an angled face towards point.
anti-climax in the end, the crowd goes quiet as Shakib drifts a wide well down the leg side to let West Indies go past the 58 mark.
Martin defends from the crease as Shakib tosses it up on off stump.

West Indies have been shot out for their second lowest total. Shakib flights this on leg and gets it to turn, past Martin's optimistic heave across the line, and onto leg stump. They were 33 for 1 at one stage, and have collapsed in bizarre fashion here, against an inspired bunch of Bangladeshis. And what's more, Shakib has 150 wickets. Well bowled, champ!

inn2.comm: works a ball on the pads to the leg side for a single.
Kayes gets a similar ball from round the stumps and tries to flick, and it goes off the pad.
too straight from Roach once again, Tamim picks up another single towards midwicket.

extra bounce from Roach, Kayes gets a top-edge as he tries to slap to the leg side and it loops up towards fine leg. An easy couple on offer, and the circumstances are made interesting by Kayes' losing his left shoe as he turned for the second.
Kayes plays carefully from the crease. No sideways movement for Roach.
angled into the pads, worked backward of square for a single to end the first over.
length ball on off stump, Tamim defends to the off side.
fuller this time, Tamim reaches out and covers the line well to defend.
on middle and leg this time, Tamim nurdles it across to midwicket for a couple.
over-pitched on middle and leg, Tamim whips straight to mid-on.
back of a length and angling across, Tamim inside-edges an airy away-from-the-body drive past his stumps. Sammy is livid at his misfortune.
on a length around middle and leg, Kayes covers the line and defends from the crease.
delicious timing from Tamim, he stands tall and punches exquisitely through the covers for a couple.
fuller ball on leg stump, Tamim plays the check drive to mid-on.
bangs this in, extravagantly short, and Kayes ducks out of the way.

dropped by Powell at first slip. That completes West Indies' misery. Roach gets one to go away fractionally off the seam, and Kayes prods at it from the crease. Healthy edge carries at a comfortable height to Powell. In and out.
another inside egde for Tamim, looks for the booming drive and nearly plays on again.
clips a fuller ball through square leg for a single to retain strike.
Sammy plugs away on a length, Tamim pushes it without timing to mid-off.
short and wide, Tamim flays the cut powerfully and Martin does well at point to dive to the left and stop a boundary.
take that Darren. Length dobblers on middle and off don't elicit much respect from Kayes. He gets forward, gets under the ball and tees off straight over the bowler's head. Majestic.
slow offcutter, Kayes plays all over it and misses., The lbw appeal is negated since the ball pitched outside leg.
over-pitched on the pads this time, Kayes whips through square leg for two more.
gets away with the half-volley this time, Kayes punches it hard but straight to mid-off.
back of a length from round the stumps, defended off the back foot towards point.
width now, Tamim promptly cuts it square for a single, but there is protection in the deep.
Kayes gets a sniff at a short ball outside off and drags the bat out of the way in time.
nice, brisk bouncer. Kayes ducks and teeters as the ball whizzes past him. The batsman chuckles later.
another short one, this time Kayes handles it better as he sways away.

Kayes is gone, and there's no noise in the ground. Short and fast from Roach again, who has worked Kayes over with his clever lengths and pace. Concerned about his rib cage, Kayes was on the back foot, committed to fending it to the leg side, but the ball took the leading edge to pop into the covers.
fired in on off and middle, cut with the turn into the covers.
plays a length ball down the track, can't get the single away yet.
slow and looped up on middle and off, Tamim pushes down the ground for one.
Nafees leans out to defend with the turn into the off side.
beaten by the turn outside off, Nafees was feeling for it well inside the line.
Nafees looks to cut again, and plays without timing into the covers.
full from Roach, and a touch outside off, Tamim can't get it away for runs.
back of a length and slightly wide, Tamim looks to crash it away with a horizontal bat, and misses.
short of a length again but closer to the stumps, Tamim lets it go through.
another sharp, short ball has the Bangladeshis in trouble. Tamim tries to work it off the hips - an ambitious choice of stroke - and ends up inside-edging past his stumps to fine leg for dour.
short again, and Tamim's beaten as he misses the nudge to the leg side.

Bangladesh have lost their second wicket earlier than the Windies lost theirs. This was a mirror image of the Ramdin wicket. Samuels slid this through without any pretence of trying to spin it, but Nafees was loose in attempted to steer it well away from the pads. The ball gladly found its way through the gap and disturbed the woodwork before Nafees could yank the bat back.
full ball outside off, defended into the off side.
tossed up on middle and leg, nudged cautiously to the leg side.
Rahim works with the spin to the leg side for a single.
Tamim leans out to defend a full ball into the off side.
huge appeal for lbw and only an inside edge could have saved Rahim there. It nipped in off a length and was headed for middle and leg. Rahim was on the crease and looking to defend. Close stuff.
Rahim gets the single this time as Roach angles into the pads, forced into the leg side.
Tamim defends with a straight bat into the covers.
short of a length and angled into the pads, Tamim whips nicely but the ball stops by the time it reaches the 30-yard circle.
Rahim is well forward and across as he defends a full ball down the track.
short of a length outside off, Rahim hangs back and defends to point.
tossed up outside off and breaking away from Tamim who shoulders arms.
over-pitched outside off, Tamim muscles it down to long-off for a single.
Rahim works a full ball off the pads through wide mid-on for one more.
half an appeal for lbw as Tamim gets squared up a touch in trying to defend down the track.
shorter ball, Tamim looks to cut and finds point.
Samuels fires this down the leg side, and Tamim helps it along almost all the way for a couple.
and he's welcomed with a crisp boundary from Rahim. Short and turning away to give him room, Rahim laps up the room with a nice little cut in front of square.
sliding down the leg side, Rahim tries to help it along but can't get it away for runs.
worked off the pads to the leg side.
Rahim covers the line on the crease and defends.
the lack of pace almost does Rahim in as he backs away and sets himself up for the cut. The ball stops and turns away sluggishly, and he chooses to defend towards point.
Tamim drives a full ball into the covers.
tossed up to Tamim, who remains resolute in defence.
leans out again and defends into the off side.
holds it back a touch, and Tamim reaches out to defend again.
Tamim lets one go through outside off, Samuels is on the verge of a maiden.
full on off, and defended back to the bowler. A part-timer bowls a maiden at the Bangladeshy pocket dynamite. What's happening here?
tossed up on middle and off, Rahim defends.
short and skidding in, Rahim forces it back to the bowler off the back foot.
a touch fuller this time and Rahim defends.
that slow turn again, Rahim pulls out of the cut once again.
can't get the flick away for runs and that ends the over.
full ball on Tamim's pads, worked to the leg side for no runs.
looks to drive extravagantly, but can't get the drive away.
after a series of dot-balls, Tamim gets Samuels away with a punchy straight drive that runs away down the ground for four.
fired in flatter, Tamim plays back to it.

fuller ball and Tamim is promptly forward and defends solidly. The TV commentator makes a great point about the technique these two sides have shown in playing spin. Bangla aren't hiding the bat behind the pad.
again, Tamim is well forward and compact in defence.
short and straightening, Rahim defends off the back foot.
fuller on middle and off, Rahim defends to the off side.
opens the face and runs a single behind point.
Tamim is defending even full tosses now.
stays back to a quicker one and forces it off the inside half to midwicket.
appeal for lbw as Tamim plays around the pads to a ball that straightens from off stump. Poor shot, but the ball wasn't doing enough.
tossed up and turning in, Rahim plays it to the leg side.
gets well forward and defends again.
nudged square with the turn for a single.
served up full on off stump, Tamim drives to long-off for a single.
fired in outside off, Rahim tries to run it square and misses.
looks to pull a quicker one now and is hopelessly late on the shot. Another appeal, this time for lbw. Where was the ball going?
Tamim plays for spin again, Samuels gets this to skid along and go off the top of his bat, over the stumps and past Ramdin for a couple of legbyes.
hangs back and redirects a length ball down to long-on.
nearly a return catch. Martin tosses it up and gets Rahim to chip it back nearly all the way.
flatter, Rahim stays on the crease and covers the line.
fired in on the stumps, nudged off the pads to the leg side.
breaking away from the off and middle line, Rahim plays it away defensively.
tossed up to Tamim who defends down the pitch.
full toss on leg stump, worked off the pads to midwicket.
flighted outside off, Tamim gets forward to defend into the covers.
short ball, he goes back to cut but doesn't impart any power.
fuller this time, Tamim drives down to long-off for a single.
Rahim covers the line as Samuels straightens one from off stump. Defended down the track.
Tamim skips out and gets pad in the way as he looks to defend.
worked off the pad towards square leg. If Tamim has a plan, I am not getting it.
strays down the leg side, Tamim nudges down to fine leg for a single.
over-pitched outside off, and finally a touch of the Tamim we all know. He gauges the flight, gets the bat down in time and powers it away through the covers.
turning down the leg side, Tamim helps it along for a couple to fine-leg.
tossed up on off stump, defended down the track.
fired in short, Rahim misses the cut as he backs away.
full ball on off stump, defended into the off side.
short ball, Rahim cuts it away cautiously.
Rahim drives with the turn down to long-on for one.

Bangladesh beat the rain, and in the process humble the Windies. Tamim works a full toss off the pads through midwicket for a single that gives Bangladesh one of their most famous wins, regardless of this being a dead rubber. I wonder if there will be any stone-throwing at buses tonight.
